Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2011 10:07AM mackers67 wrote: Hi Elizabeth, Thanks very much for your reply much apprecieated.  Its the first time I have posted on here. Just a bit of background; I am from the UK (not that that makes any difference, just adds to the plot !!!) I was originally dx by accident no symptoms then I got a lump under my arm, the rest has been as you would imagine !! I have recently had a scan as my chemo part of my treatment on this occasion is complete.  The CAT revealed no further spread and bone mets responding, however I know that bone/pet scan will give full details regarding my bone and Im not having one of those until next month. So maybe it is my rib healing as you said,  its just it hurts all the time now and I wondered if anyone had experienced this while on Taxotere.  As you said Taxotere is a very good chemo and I really good results with it, so much so that in the end I was worried it would keep on working and would liquidize my internal organs when it had finished with the disease (joke!!!) .  However I know that chemo takes a lot longer to work on bone rather than soft tissue but I will just have to hope. I read your posts alot and I think you are very courageous and funny woman.  Well you cheer me up !! Thanks again for your time. Txx

Posts.Title: Rant / Oops, some good news / I AM stupider! konakat hrf

Posts.Content: mackers67 wrote: Hi I went to the oncologist today..... how many times have we heard that ??!! I just wanted to share this with you, as I know how much it meant to me to hear ANY good news at ALL from any of you.  I have undergone 4 x FEC  4 x  Taxotere...and the herceptin 4 x (so far) before planned mastectomy.  I was diagnosed at stage 4 from the start (I do tend to ignore things !!!). Anyway had a mastectomy two weeks ago... ok now..I received biopsy results today from the breast as Oncologist and Surgeon wanted to measure response from the Chemo as I have Bone mets and to allow them to gauge how the treatment was responding in the bone and stray cells in my system. Results:  From a 27 x 19mm tumour and additional 110mm total mass (told you I like to ignore things!!!)... They found after treatment a total of 10m mass and that was dotted around the breast, as Oncologist said last men standing( meaning cancer cells)!!! I dont know how things will progress and I dont even like to think about it and I dont like to tempt fate...but it looks positive for now.... have to have radiotherapy, zometa, hormone treatment etc etc etc... I was surrounded by women while receiving my treatment who had stage 2 and 3 cancers and I never wanted to share my story with them, as I didnt want to frighten them.... So I didnt say anything and let them think I was in the same situation as them and I would say that as my tumour was so big it had to  be shrank to allow me to have a mastectomy, which is why Docs wanted to measure my response. to treatment.    So I could honestly say to them, maybe not for everyone and again who knows what is round the corner, but at this moment FEC Taxotere and herceptin really does work and some people can have a very positive response from the treatment. I really dont like being too optimistic about my condition and feel VERY much for all those of ladies that arent having the greatest of times at the moment, but to all the ladies out there on these treatments I just wanted to share my experience to give us all a bit more hope !!!!  Love x Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Encouraging News I Hope.. !!!! mackers67 mackers67

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2011 12:47AM mackers67 wrote: I'm still in treatment, at the hospital all the time, thinking of getting myself a job there, receptionist be good know all the directions! I think I will get cat scans and bone scan every three months for a year and if ok then every 6 months. Get me "Mrs hopeful' I've got to physio twice a week now as well as can't get my arm and body straight enough for my radiotherapy!!! Told u I'm always there!! Xx It's all go!! Xxxxx

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 04:53AM mackers67 wrote:  Somewhereinbetween I am sorry to hear your news.... the same thing happened to me, even after I had chemotherapy and  the other  treatment both an MRI and CAT said NED in my breast, when they took it off and did a biopsy there was a minuscule bit left that the scans didn't pick up.  So although I was like you a bit frightened I am so glad I had the complete mastectomy, so its gone from my breast..... at least !!! To be very honest the mastectomy hasn't bothered me too much, just got a new bra and although I do say so myself look like a new women !!!  Just had my hair cut into an actual style and I think I look very well considering !!!  I try "soo" hard to remain positive and most of the time it works... but I know its not easy!! xx PS  And you will probably be given the choice of a reconstruction ??  always an option?? I am not as knowledgeable as a lot of the ladies on the boards but if you want to ask me anything about my op and after treatment please just ask
